intro: Goniothalamus euneurus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
